title: How to Make Cardamom and Clove Green Tea

steps.headline: Take a saucepan.
steps.description: Add the water to it and put it on the heat. Bring the water to boil.

steps.headline: Add the dried green tea leaves, cardamoms, cloves and lemon juice into boiling water.
steps.description:
Remember to cut open cardamoms from one side to open up the flavor inside. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7d\/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/7d\/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid5616631-v4-728px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"484","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Lower the heat source.
steps.description: Put a lid on the saucepan such that it leaves a little space for excess steam to come out.

steps.headline: Leave for 2 to 5 minutes.
steps.description: It is necessary to leave it for a few time to allow the real essence and flavor to come out of the natural ingredients.

steps.headline: Remove the lid.
steps.description: The amount of water should be reduced to almost 1 cup by now.

steps.headline: Put a strainer on the cup.
Pour the liquid from the saucepan into the cup.
Serve hot.
steps.description:
Enjoy your gently spiced green tea drink. For a cold tea, leave it aside for couple of minutes until it cools down. Add crushed ice into it and enjoy. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/8\/82\/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/aid5616631-v4-728px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"484","licensing":"

text:
Take a saucepan. Add the water to it and put it on the heat. Bring the water to boil. Add the dried green tea leaves, cardamoms, cloves and lemon juice into boiling water. Remember to cut open cardamoms from one side to open up the flavor inside. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/7d/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid5616631-v4-728px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"484","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Lower the heat source. Put a lid on the saucepan such that it leaves a little space for excess steam to come out. Leave for 2 to 5 minutes. It is necessary to leave it for a few time to allow the real essence and flavor to come out of the natural ingredients. Remove the lid. The amount of water should be reduced to almost 1 cup by now. Put a strainer on the cup. Pour the liquid from the saucepan into the cup. Add honey and stir. Serve hot. Enjoy your gently spiced green tea drink. For a cold tea, leave it aside for couple of minutes until it cools down. Add crushed ice into it and enjoy. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/82/Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/aid5616631-v4-728px-Make-Cardamom-and-Clove-Green-Tea-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"484","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
